content: The Financial Services and General Government (FSGG) appropriations bill funds independent agencies in Title V that manage federal real property, regulate financial institutions, and oversee mail delivery. It also includes provisions on Cuba sanctions and funding for the Department of the Treasury, Executive Office of the President, and judiciary. The FSGG appropriations bill funds independent agencies in Title V, along with general provisions in Title VII and Cuba sanctions in Title I. It also funds the Department of the Treasury, Executive Office of the President, judiciary, and District of Columbia. Mandatory retirement accounts are typically funded in Title VI, which also includes general provisions for FSGG agencies. Additional titles may address financial regulation issues. The FSGG appropriations bill funds various agencies including the Department of the Treasury, Executive Office of the President, judiciary, and District of Columbia. It also covers mandatory retirement accounts and general provisions for FSGG agencies. Financial regulation issues may be addressed in additional titles. The bill has been in its current form since 2007. The FSGG appropriations bill focuses on funding financial services agencies, excluding many financial regulatory agencies. The bill has been in its current form since 2007.
